title: Antietam National Battlefield: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Safety       Safety and Regulations While touring the park stay alert to traffic. Bicyclists should use caution descending hills. Maryland Law requires riders under the age of 16 to wear an approved D.O.T. helmet. Cyclists are subject to Maryland Traffic Law. Please use trails to minimize contact with stinging nettles, ticks, and snakes. Good walking shoes should be worn on the trails and be aware of groundhog holes. Do not climb on cannons, monuments, fences or trees. Relic hunting is prohibited. Report Crimes in your National Parks Toll Free  1-866-677-6677 Report these crimes against National Park resources and Park emergencies:    Looting of archeological or historic resources  Plant and tree cutting   Fish and wildlife poaching   Boundary encroachment and trespassing   Dumping and water pollution   Vandalism and arson   Marijuana cultivation or drug labs   Public use violations such as illegal campsites and off-road vehicles.  If you see a violation, record the following information:  Date  Time   Location   Vehicle license number  Vehicle description   Description of person(s) involved  Details of violation Any other details, no matter how insignificant they may seem.
